thread.title: #TubeStrike: How people in London got to work and the funniest social media jokes
thread.title_full: #TubeStrike: How people in London got to work and the funniest social media jokes

author: Helena Horton
title: #TubeStrike: How people in London got to work and the funniest social media jokes
text:
#TubeStrike: How people in London got to work and the funniest social media jokes The Tube Strike has brought London to a halt Credit: John Stillwell/PA Helena Horton 9 January 2017 ‚Ä¢ 9:44am 
T he tube strike has brought London to a halt as most stations in Zone 1 have no Underground services and the buses and streets are crammed with annoyed commuters and confused tourists. 
There was commuter chaos on Monday morning, with more expected at rush hour in the evening. 
Clapham junction station was evacuated as commuters tried in vain to get to work. 
However, many have had a stiff upper lip about the transport woes they faced today. Watch | 'Ridiculous' crowds at Clapham Junction due to Tube Strike 00:24 
G rim humour has won the day on social media as people post pictures of their commute from hell. 
Got a particularly great picture of an unusual or horrifying London commute? Send it through to helena.horton@telegraph.co.uk. Think you can have a relaxing stroll to work? Think again A photo posted by jenetee (@jenetee) on Jan 9, 2017 at 1:07am PST Commuters trudged en masse to their jobs A photo posted by Sarah (@scarttz) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:59am PST And complained about it at length when they got to work There will be huge commuting one-upmanship on display tomorrow.'You walked? I had to take a dolphin at Greenwich.' ‚Äî Dan (@ThatConnArtist) January 8, 2017 Some were quite melodramatic It's not even 7am at Clapham Junction and I already feel like Simba in the stampede scene of The Lion King #TubeStrike #london ‚Äî Aisling (@aislingroseg) January 9, 2017 Even comparing it to the Titanic Clapham Junction is a very similar scene to when the Titanic is sinking & they're trying to get everyone onto the lifeboats #TubeStrike #TfL ‚Äî gabriella sylvia (@gabsylvia_) January 9, 2017 Others took the whole thing in their stride Loved the commuter taking to his scooter today along The Thames #TubeStrike pic.twitter.com/ZHHqixS4XI ‚Äî Nigel Bowles (@NigelBowles) January 9, 2017 Look how unhappy everyone is Stay clear from Liverpool Street #TubeStrike pic.twitter.com/Zf5YN6ksli ‚Äî Luize Lazdane (@luize_l) January 9, 2017 Who would have thought people would be so desperate to work on a Monday morning? A photo posted by Karla Whitney (@kdw1982) on Jan 9, 2017 at 1:03am PST Even our Mayor isn't immune A sign of the chaos caused by the Tube strike that @SadiqKhan is supposed to be on Radio 4 now but is stuck in traffic #TubeStrike ‚Äî Pippa Crerar (@PippaCrerar) January 9, 2017 At least everyone is getting some fresh air... A photo posted by Lauren (@ldr.lens) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:57am PST ...full of Uber fumes ‚Äî Chris Parsons (@ChrisParsons274) January 9, 2017 Don't forget the real victims of the strike Spare a thought for the tourists unable to get from Leicester Square to Covent Garden without the Piccadilly line üíî #TubeStrike ‚Äî Rupert Monkhouse (@pert1993) January 9, 2017 The trains in action are empty A photo posted by Mark Potter (@mepotterlondon) on Jan 9, 2017 at 1:17am PST Clapham Junction looks like a living nightmare A photo posted by Jasmine Cooke (@jasminemmaa) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:54am PST At least we Brits know how to queue 
L ook at that line! 100's of people queueing to get into Clapham Junction which is now exit only #london #trains #TubeStrike #BORING pic.twitter.com/gDLTQYmyEx ‚Äî Jodie Nicole (@jodie19lo) January 9, 2017 Some seemed to have quite a nice commute A photo posted by Ana üá¨üáß‚öñÔ∏è (@crateee) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:52am PST As long as it's not busy, you get a better view than on the tube A photo posted by Gavin (@west.marsh) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:48am PST An endless line of walkers A photo posted by Houda (@houditabonita) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:46am PST Look at all those people! A video posted by Liam Pearson (@leeam1989) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:44am PST Sometimes living in London is such a treat... A photo posted by Chris Elrin (@chriselrin) on Jan 9, 2017 at 12:44am PST
